---
title: "A great ggplot tip!"
subtitle: "Learning about ggplot"
author: "Ricardo"
date: "2022-10-14"
categories: [code, ggplot2, R, tips]
image: "https://isabella-b.com/blog/ggplot2-theme-elements-reference/ggplot2-theme-elements-reference-v2_hu8994090e1960a0a71878a3756da20076_580819_2000x2000_fit_lanczos_2.png"
draft: true
---




## What this post is about?

- `ggplot2` tips


## History

Some time ago, lost through the deep arms of the internet ðŸ˜Ž, I have found a great drawing with all the theme elements references of a plot within `ggplot2`.

But, as is well known, if you don't save that, it will be lost forever.

Except when you have a great community in [twitter](http://twitter.com/), and there is a bunch of good people trying to help everyone!

*Some time ahead...*

I finally found it! Here it is:



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![ggplot2 theme elements references, by Isabella Benabaye.](https://isabella-b.com/blog/ggplot2-theme-elements-reference/ggplot2-theme-elements-reference-v2_hu8994090e1960a0a71878a3756da20076_580819_2000x2000_fit_lanczos_2.png){#fig-ggplot}
:::
:::



I also found the [post](https://isabella-b.com/blog/ggplot2-theme-elements-reference/) on her blog, with better quality [images](https://isabella-b.com/files/ggplot2-theme-elements-reference-v2.png) and/or a [pdf](https://isabella-b.com/files/ggplot2-theme-elements-reference-v2.pdf) file.


## The history continues...

More interesting: actually, she had her idea after this twitter post from Henry Wang:


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![Henry Wang's tweet.](index_files/figure-html/fig-tweet-1.png){#fig-tweet width=70%}
:::
:::



And, he also made a nice [post](https://henrywang.nl/ggplot2-theme-elements-demonstration/) about the subject (where you can download his version of `ggplot2` theme elements demonstration).


## Finishing

That's it, enjoy the creativity and good ideas from all these people, soon I'll bring some more.

Thanks for the reading, cheers!

R.


---
